page.title: 15WOODLAND MANAGEMENT
page.content: Logging makes a little money because it is along term process. If the wood was chopped down all at once no money would be made the next year. Very little labour is used. Trees are being replanted but they take 50-60 years to grow. Most of the woods are parts of estates. Shooting makes more money much more quickly. Pheasants are the main sport. They are bred each year. Not all of the woods are intensively used like this. A couple of the woods are being neglected. They are hardly used at all. In these woods are found things like orchids which are quiet rare. Sometimes there are a few deer but there seem to be many foxes and rabbits. The unused woods seem to be mainly ash. The intensively used woods are broadleaved and conifers.
